Through the discipline of ethnomusicology, this course situates thought about music in the broader history of ideas about culture. We consider the history of the field, its gradual awakening to the viewpoints of other cultures, and its perspective on the present. Course work includes close readings of ethnomusicological texts, transcription and analysis, and written assignments. Space permitting, the class is open to upper-level undergraduate students with instructor permission.
In Old Aud Ethno rooms. MMUS and DMA students must contact the instructor for permission to register.
description: Preliminary studies in the discipline of ethnomusicology, with an emphasis on history and orientations.
